##========================================================================
## NAME
=pod

=head1 NAME

Tie::File::Indexed::Freeze - tied array access to indexed data files: Storable::freeze()-encoded references (native byte-order)

=cut

##========================================================================
## SYNOPSIS
=pod

=head1 SYNOPSIS

 use Tie::File::Indexed::Freeze;
 tie(my @data, 'Tie::File::Indexed::Freeze', $filename, %options) or die ...
 
 ##-- add some data
 $data[0] = {foo=>'bar'}; # transparently encode/decode perl hashes
 $data[1] = [1..10];      # ... or arrays
 $data[2] = \42;          # ... or scalar-refs
 $data[3] = undef;        # ... or undef
 print $data[1];          # retrieve & print a stored value

=cut

##========================================================================
## DESCRIPTION
=pod

=head1 DESCRIPTION

Tie::File::Indexed::Freeze provides a
L<Tie::File::Indexed|Tie::File::Indexed> subclass for
storing arrays of perl data structures encoded using the Storable module.
Data items are written in the native byte-order using
L<Storable::freeze()|Storable/"freeze">.

See L<Tie::File::Indexed/"SUBCLASSES"> for an overview of the built-in
L<Tie::File::Indexed|Tie::File::Indexed> subclasses.

=cut
